Mathematical and computational BS! Urban legend has it that Le Verrier's calculation of the location of a planet perturbing the orbit of Uranus is bunk. As they are, these calculations could never have found Neptune. If you had the background to repeat them, you would see the validity of this statement. The discovery of Neptune where Le Verrier thought it might be was a fortuitous ACCIDENT. But urban legend has prevailed for more than 100 yrs because the laymen community wants it so.

Secondly, any numerical multibody calculations that are said to span 2B yrs and give accurate representations of Kuiper/planetary orbits is more than mere BS, it's BS^10. Chaos will set in big time after around a few million simulation yrs. That means there would be no predictability of any accuracy after that time span. Also the numerical error propagation of roundoff and truncation will swamp the results later on around the 20 - 25M mark. Your Cal Tech expert didnt address this...or know about this. These long-term simulations use very rudimentary gravitational force laws that facilitate a rapid (approximate) calculation of the Newtonian inverse-square force law. The result is a myriad of possible orbital configurations, but none of them could be pointed to as definitive. After many simulations, trends could be spotted, but these could be numerical artifacts that consistently pop up because of the crude gravitational model used in the multibody calculations.

No reasonable prediction of the existence of a 9th planet will be found from these numerical simulations. A 9th planet of 5 earth masses
interacting with billions of Kuiper bodies will have no influence that could ever be detected. Detection could be possible with a Jupiter-sized body, but that would have been detected thru astronomical observations decades ago. So, this leaves you with a bunk video.

What if there is not only planet 9, but also planet 10 or even more? Right now people searching for planet 9 assume that there is only planet 9 and that would be it. They have an estimate where its orbit would be IF it is the last planet in the solar system. But if there is also planet 10 or even more, then the orbit of planet 9 may be where people, who search for planet 9 under the assumption that it is the „last planet“, have ruled out it could be. The point I am making is that there can be even more than one undiscovered planet. And then everything gets much more complicated concerning maths and orbits of Kuiper belt objects and the orbits of the not yet discovered planets 9, 10, … . So maybe the reason why planet 9 has not been discovered yet, might be that the search for planet 9 so far was made under the false assumption that there is no planet 10. So the reason why planet 9 has not been discovered yet, might be that there is planet 10 or even more.

I wonder if there is a way to look at the orbit of the masses we are tracking now and use that to predict where a 9th planet might be. For example masses A, B, and C all have slightly odd orbits compared to their neighbors or unforeseen changes to their orbit over a X year span, so you check their orbits to see if they are aligned with each other at any point in time, we'll use 5,000 years. Then use that as a baseline as to WHEN (5,000 years ago) an unknown mass altered the orbit of object A, B, and C at location xxx.yyy.zzz. Now you have a starting point. If you do that with multiple objects in multiple locations you start to map an orbits path and frequency, helping you project where it will be right now.

Yes I realize this is a relatively basic line of thinking but I'm not sure if we're capable of doing this given our current tracking data. We may need an AI to process all the object we're tracking and guide us where to look.

20. Those to whom We have given the Book know this as they know their own sons. Those who have lost their own souls refuse therefore to believe.
21. Who doth more wrong than he who inventeth a lie against Allah or rejecteth His signs? But verily the wrong-doers never shall prosper.
22. One day shall We gather them all together: We shall say to those who ascribed partners (to Us): "Where are the partners whom ye (invented and) talked about?"
23. There will then be (left) no subterfuge for them but to say: "By Allah our Lord, we were not those who joined gods with Allah."
24. Behold! how they lie against their own souls! But the (lie) which they invented will leave them in the lurch.
25. Of them there are some who (pretend to) listen to thee; but We have thrown veils on their hearts, So they understand it not, and deafness in their ears; if they saw every one of the signs, not they will believe in them; in so much that when they come to thee, they (but) dispute with thee; the Unbelievers say: "These are nothing but tales of the ancients."
26. Others they keep away from it, and themselves they keep away; but they only destroy their own souls, and they perceive it not.
27. If thou couldst but see when they are confronted with the Fire! They will say: "Would that we were but sent back! Then would we not reject the signs of our Lord, but would be amongst those who believe!"
28. Yea, in their own (eyes) will become manifest what before they concealed. But if they were returned, they would certainly relapse to the things they were forbidden, for they are indeed liars.
29. And they (sometimes) say: "There is nothing except our life on this earth, and never shall we be raised up again."
30. If thou couldst but see when they are confronted with their Lord! He will say: "Is not this the truth?" They will say: "Yea, by our Lord!" He will say: "Taste ye then the penalty, because ye rejected Faith."
31. Lost indeed are they who treat it as a falsehood that they must meet Allah,- until on a sudden the hour is on them, and they say: "Ah! woe unto us that we took no thought of it"; for they bear their burdens on their backs, and evil indeed are the burdens that they bear?
32. What is the life of this world but play and amusement? But best is the home in the hereafter, for those who are righteous. Will ye not then understand?
33. We know indeed the grief which their words do cause thee: It is not thee they reject: it is the signs of Allah, which the wicked condemn.
34. Rejected were the messengers before thee: with patience and constancy they bore their rejection and their wrongs, until Our aid did reach them: there is none that can alter the words (and decrees) of Allah. Already hast thou received some account of those messengers.
35. If their spurning is hard on thy mind, yet if thou wert able to seek a tunnel in the ground or a ladder to the skies and bring them a sign,- (what good?). If it were Allah's will, He could gather them together unto true guidance: so be not thou amongst those who are swayed by ignorance (and impatience)!
36. Those who listen (in truth), be sure, will accept: as to the dead, Allah will raise them up; then will they be turned unto Him.
37. They say: "Why is not a sign sent down to him from his Lord?" Say: "Allah hath certainly power to send down a sign: but most of them understand not.
38. There is not an animal (that lives) on the earth, nor a being that flies on its wings, but (forms part of) communities like you. Nothing have we omitted from the Book, and they (all) shall be gathered to their Lord in the end.
39. Those who reject our signs are deaf and dumb,- in the midst of darkness profound: whom Allah willeth, He leaveth to wander: whom He willeth, He placeth on the way that is straight.
40. Say: "Think ye to yourselves, if there come upon you the wrath of Allah, or the Hour (that ye dread), would ye then call upon other than Allah?- (reply) if ye are truthful!
41. "Nay,- On Him would ye call, and if it be His will, He would remove (the distress) which occasioned your call upon Him, and ye would forget (the false gods) which ye join with Him!"
42. Before thee We sent (messengers) to many nations, and We afflicted the nations with suffering and adversity, that they might learn humility.
43. When the suffering reached them from us, why then did they not learn humility? On the contrary their hearts became hardened, and Satan made their (sinful) acts seem alluring to them.
44. But when they forgot the warning they had received, We opened to them the gates of all (good) things, until, in the midst of their enjoyment of Our gifts, on a sudden, We called them to account, when lo! they were plunged in despair!
45. Of the wrong-doers the last remnant was cut off. Praise be to Allah, the Cherisher of the worlds.
46. Say: "Think ye, if Allah took away your hearing and your sight, and sealed up your hearts, who - a god other than Allah - could restore them to you?" See how We explain the signs by various (symbols); yet they turn aside.
47. Say: "Think ye, if the punishment of Allah comes to you, whether suddenly or openly, will any be destroyed except those who do wrong?
48. We send the messengers only to give good news and to warn: so those who believe and mend (their lives),- upon them shall be no fear, nor shall they grieve.
49. But those who reject our signs,- them shall punishment touch, for that they ceased not from transgressing.
50. Say: "I tell you not that with me are the treasures of Allah, nor do I know what is hidden, nor do I tell you I am an angel. I but follow what is revealed to me." Say: "can the blind be held equal to the seeing?" Will ye then consider not?
51. Give this warning to those in whose (hearts) is the fear that they will be brought (to judgment) before their Lord: except for Him they will have no protector nor intercessor: that they may guard (against evil).
52. Send not away those who call on their Lord morning and evening, seeking His face. In naught art thou accountable for them, and in naught are they accountable for thee, that thou shouldst turn them away, and thus be (one) of the unjust.
53. Thus did We try some of them by comparison with others, that they should say: "Is it these then that Allah hath favoured from amongst us?" Doth not Allah know best those who are grateful?
54. When those come to thee who believe in Our signs, Say: "Peace be on you: Your Lord hath inscribed for Himself (the rule of) mercy: verily, if any of you did evil in ignorance, and thereafter repented, and amend (his conduct), lo! He is Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.
55. Thus do We explain the signs in detail: that the way of the sinners may be shown up.
56. Say: "I am forbidden to worship those - others than Allah - whom ye call upon." Say: "I will not follow your wain desires: If I did, I would stray from the path, and be not of the company of those who receive guidance."
57. Say: "For me, I (work) on a clear sign from my Lord, but ye reject Him. What ye would see hastened, is not in my power. The command rests with none but Allah: He declares the truth, and He is the best of judges."
58. Say: "If what ye would see hastened were in my power, the matter would be settled at once between you and me. But Allah knoweth best those who do wrong."
59. With Him are the keys of the unseen, the treasures that none knoweth but He. He knoweth whatever there is on the earth and in the sea. Not a leaf doth fall but with His knowledge: there is not a grain in the darkness (or depths) of the earth, nor anything fresh or dry (green or withered), but is (inscribed) in a record clear (to those who can read).
60. It is He who doth take your souls by night, and hath knowledge of all that ye have done by day: by day doth He raise you up again; that a term appointed be fulfilled; In the end unto Him will be your return; then will He show you the truth of all that ye did.
61. He is the irresistible, (watching) from above over His worshippers, and He sets guardians over you. At length, when death approaches one of you, Our angels take his soul, and they never fail in their duty.

What I believe is that there are many other far objects with orbits oriented in those other ways, but they just don't happen to be close enough at the moment to see. These kinds of objects like Sedna orbit too slowly to see at all different points along their orbits. We can imagine them stuck at a random spot on their orbits. They are only close enough to have had the potential to have been seen in this brief time by this new humanity in a small sliver of their orbits near their perihelions. We would not have seen Sedna if it had been somewhere else in its orbit when humans invented telescopes and started looking way past Neptune. It would have been too faint and small to see and this is probably the case with many more objects.

The null hypothosis that these objects just happened to be like this isn't insignificant, either. 1 in 500 is understandable. There are other logical reasons for the allignment, like tides from close encounters with stars and stuff having affected the orbits of these distant objects most vulnerable to tidal disruption.

Ok here is why scientists get confused about whether Planet 9 exists. Its true a mysterious amount of mass in our solar system is affecting other planets, comets, & asteroids.  People say that due to its calculated mass it has to be planet. But they are wrong. You see it goes back to when our Solar System was formed. What caused all the concretion that formed all our planets moons and sun is dark matter that is sloughed off black holes when they eat too much. You see when a sun or planet crosses the event horizon it is converted to dark matter aka black hole matter. As the Black Hole eats it reach a tipping point where it cannot absorb and hold on to all the newly made black hole material. The result is that it is shot out the poles of the black hole at 83% the speed of life. Remeber just a teaspoon of black hole material is suppose to weigh thousands of long tons. So when it finally slows down and starts absorbing material to form suns moons and planets. Some times like in our case this dark matter/black hole material ends up in a place in space where it plays a tug of war against other planets and objects. Soon it becomes stagnant and the reason why we cannot see it is because it is.......Dark Matter aka Black Hole material.

One thing these astronomers need to be very careful about is in estimating that because we find exoplanets with five earth masses in other stellar systems, that this is the norm for all stellar systems (and thus concluding that we must have a ninth planet of that mass here).

The problem is that the inherent difficulties in discovering exoplanets, mainly due to the fact that their stars simply contain most of the mass (and illumination) is that detecting small, earth mass exoplanets is a lot more difficult than finding large mass exoplanets. Just because we haven’t been able to find too many smaller mass exoplanets doesn’t mean they don’t exist; it could mean that they are much more difficult to discover, given the limits of our current technology.

Bear in mind, we have yet to directly observe any exoplanets. Any luminosity they have is just overwhelmed by the luminosity of their star(s). We infer their existence by observing the stars behavior — using two methods.

First, we observe the slight wobbles in the star’s motion, which are the result of the gravitational tug of planets. Obviously large planets are going to cause larger wobbles. Second, we measure very carefully any periodic dimming of the star’s luminosity, which could be caused b a transit of an orbiting planet. This method only works if the stellar system is in the right alignment with regard to Earth, so that rules out a lot of stars. Also, larger planets are going to cause a larger dimming of the luminosity of the star in question than smaller planets are.

So both methods tend to discover larger exoplanets. It’s actually remarkable that we are able to detect exoplanets at all. But we must be very careful about generalizing the structures of these stellar systems, based on our limited ability to detect exoplanets. Yes, it can appear that planets 5 times the mass of Earth may SEEM to be the norm, but that could simply be that given our current technology, it’s FAR more difficult to detect planets smaller than 5 times the mass of Earth. Such planets would be far more difficult to detect. But we shouldn’t, given our very limited data, conclude that small, Earth mass, or smaller planets are therefore much more rare. They may just be much more difficult to detect, even with the advanced technology we currently have.

There is no planet nine. For planet nine to be planet nine it would have to be a planet like Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.

This means that it would have to clear its orbit, which becomes progressively harder the farther a planet is from the sun. So planet 9 could be several times the size of planet earth and it would still be a dwarf planet.

What they are calling planet 9 might be out there and it might be larger than the earth, but it would still be a dwarf planet using current definitions.

So, the three criteria of the IAU for a full-sized planet are:
1) It is in orbit around the Sun.
2) It has sufficient mass to assume hydrostatic equilibrium (a nearly round shape).
3) It has “cleared the neighborhood” around its orbit.

Pluto got disqualified for not 'clearing the neighborhood' as it spends @90% of it's orbit in the Kuiper Belt. For 20 yr segments it is not in the Kuiper Belt, and is actually closer to the sun than Neptune, so thus is in a clear neighborhood.

Ceres was disqualified for being in the Asteroid Belt, same reason, not a clear neighborhood.

If the Kuiper Belt disqualified Pluto, then how would Planet 9 (Planet X) not be disqualified for the same requirement? If there is a Planet 9 (X) in the Kuiper Belt wouldn't it too fail Criteria 3?

Beyond the Kuiper Belt is the Oort Cloud, a 3 dimensional cloud of debris. How would anything in the Oort Cloud be capable of “clearing the neighborhood” around its orbit? This is assuming the Oort cloud is considered within the Sun's Heliosphere, which is not certain. Some models have the area between the Kuiper Belt and the Oort Cloud as interstellar space. Not sure you could define an entity beyond a star's heliosphere and in interstellar space as a planet.

Simple logic and the IAU definition disqualify almost any chance that there is a Planet 9 (X)

Why do we see stars !? A star is an omnidirectional emitter of coherent electromagnetic waves! In essence, we see a pillar of a ray of light! Everything is very simple! We see stars only because our Sun in our galaxy flies in sync with the rest of the stars! The distance between the stars is increasing, but it is so very - a slow process that lasts for millions of years. That is, an astronomer cannot observe the change in such long processes, since Earth time flies by with lightning speed! And so, now we know that distant stars are statically attached to one coordinate point in the sky, but why does the light of the stars travels so long distances, reaching our optic nerve? 8558
It's all about COHERENCE! The emitted light of the stars forms a kind of laser beam of light, in one of the radiation spectra such as X-rays this radiation is most effective. The rotation of the stars around their axis further enhances the coherence by pumping the beam. In fact, we see a column of a ray of light, but we see only that beam-column that flies in our direction, forming a peak - an energy point. In neighboring solar systems, people observe the phase radiation of the beam but several degrees to the side. The formed point in the sky confirms that the star is exactly in the place of its coordinates! if the Star could move relative to our Sun, then no coherent ray would be able to form.

Is it odd for me to comment that we have both the Kuiper Belt and the Oort Cloud floating out there, the mass of the former being 10% of the Earth's, and the mass of the latter being 5 times that of the Earth. Who knows the actual mass of these objects, but were they to coalesce, there would be a planet roughly equivalent to one Earth out there. This is the atmosphere of the solar system. I suppose one day we could launch a large number of drones into the outer solar system and program them to alter the trajectories of these objects so that they coalesce. Recently, it was hypothesised that rather than being a planet, this mysterious 'ninth body' could actually be something called a 'primordial black hole' - a hypothetical body believed to be created almost directly after the big bang, along with maybe billions or trillions of similar objects, that range in mass of about 5-15 masses of Earth. The main idea behind the ninth body being one of these primordial black holes was to explain the fact that no matter how hard we've looked, we are still yet to see it. As such, a tiny black hole that would be about the size of a fist, definitely with no  bright, emitting accretion disc, would explain it, and the only method of finding it would be through a method called micro-lensing, unless some other process fortuitously occurs to increase emissions in some part of the spectrum that is already highly observed.

The Sumerians, between 6 to 9000 years ago properly outlined nine planets in the solar system with a 10th planet that makes an occasional pass through the solar system. One of the nine planets was Pluto, which if memory serves me correct, they identified as being a moon of Jupiter that was pulled out of its orbit by the tenth planet. They also properly identify the asteroid belt, and also they had a description of how the moon was formed which predates our current theory by several thousand years. Seems we're just starting to read understand the solar system as they knew it almost 10,000 years ago. By the accepted definition Pluto is a planet, it's large enough to be a sphere and 70% of its orbit is clear of other orbital bodies. Classification has a lot to do with it. You have this distinction between "true planets" and "dwarf planets" that aren't capable of clearing as much debris. If one counted dwarf planets(Ceres, Pluto, Eris, and the rest of the gang) then we'd be up to 13. One can also consider a world in which we excluded not just dwarf planets but also gas giants(after all they're mostly hydrogen, and could be considered a smaller variant of brown giant, or failed star, and there's not really a solid surface for landing probes on or doing anything interesting). In that case we'd only have five. Or if moons were counted we'd have hundreds.

There's one main reason I think there might potentially be a 9th planet out there, it's the Kuiper belt, why is it so stable? Why isn't gravity from Neptune and Uranus pulling Kuiper belt asteroids into the outer solar system and generally destabilizing it? The reason that the asteroids in the asteroid belt are in such stable orbits and not flying all over the solar system is because the gravitational pull of Jupiter stabilizes their orbits and regulates the entire asteroid belt. I'm probably wrong about this but I think something must be out there regulating the orbits of the Kuiper Belt Objects. In addition to that giving the trans neptunian objects their wonky elliptical orbits, it doesn't make any sense for them to have those orbits naturally, however that doesn't really count because they could have been moons of the gas giants at one point and then got flung out into the outer solar system settling into their current weird orbits

SciShow Space recently published a video about strange meteorites. They described a meteorite name Almahata Sitta which, when fragments were opened, were found to contain diamonds larger than anyone expected. The implication of this, along with the impurities found in the diamonds, was that the diamonds formed in the interior of a planet sized body that had been smashed into (relatively) small pieces during some kind of collision. I left the following tongue-in-cheek comment:

"I know. Almahata Sitta is a remnant of Planet 9. The reason we can't find planet 9 is that it was destroyed in a collision but its gravitational effects remain until something equally big rolls through the Kuiper Belt and rearranges things again. Whatever collided with Planet 9 must have been similar in size and they collided in a way that obliterated them both, creating a large number of the small objects that make up the Kuiper Belt."

The more I think about it, the more I wonder if my speculation is not so tongue-in-cheek, though I don't know enough about any of this to really address it. Is this even a possibility?

The kuiper cliff is a region in the kuiper belt beginning at 46au to 70au that has been swept clean, meaning, something massive, Jupiter mass or larger, possibly a sub-brown dwarf, is responsible for sweeping that region clean.  Also, scientists have searched in the infrared spectrum for this object and probably discovered it but mis-identified it due to it's lack of proper motion, meaning, if it's approaching us or moving away from us it could have been mistaken for a distant brown dwarf.

The Kuiper cliff is proof that something massive is lurking around out there, either a massive planet or a sub-brown dwarf, scientists know this, they're only waiting to discover it.  Sedna and other kuiper belt objects give it away due to their extreme elliptical orbits.

I really like the different styles of scientific discovery: theoretical versus observational.

Prof. Batygin is the optimistic theoreticist that shows that their equations predict the existence of Planet 9 and not only that can tell you how likely it is that he is wrong and where to look.

Prof Jewitt is the cautious observationalist that points out the biases inherent in our knowledge and methods of measurement and believes in observed evidence as proof of theory.

Nyx (/nɪks/;[1] Greek: Νύξ, Núx, "Night";[2] Latin: Nox) is the Greek goddess (or personification) of the night. A shadowy figure, Nyx stood at or near the beginning of creation and mothered other personified deities such as Hypnos (Sleep) and Thanatos (Death), with Erebus (Darkness). Her appearances are sparse in surviving mythology, but reveal her as a figure of such exceptional power and beauty that she is feared by Zeus himself.

In Greek mythology, Aether (/ˈiːθər/; Ancient Greek: Αἰθήρ, Aither, pronounced [aitʰɛ̌ːr]) is one of the primordial deities. Aether is the personification of the "upper sky".[1] He embodies the pure upper air that the gods breathe, as opposed to the normal air (ἀήρ, aer) breathed by mortals. Like Tartarus and Erebus, Aether may have had shrines in ancient Greece, but he had no temples and is unlikely to have had a cult.

Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune emit radio waves where the solar wind hits their magnetospheres, and the interaction accelerates the ions and electrons.  In this way they can be detected by radio astronomy.  In other words we don't necessarily need light based instruments to detect this hypothetical Planet 9.  The problem is that the solar system's planets emit radio signals mostly in long wavelengths that  are in the middle of the bands set aside for radio and TV communication on Earth.  So with all this noise it would be difficult to detect a planet so distant.  I would ask these scientists if they have tried to use LOFAR, a low frequency array radio telescope to search for Planet 9's signal.

Let's just argue about planets for a moment. Alright so lets start with fish. A fish is a fish whether it lives in freshwater, saltwater, a river, a lake, a pond, or attached to another fish i.e, Remora. The same way a planet is still a planet even if it orbits another planet or hasn't "cleared out its orbit". Astronomers attempt to keep the number of planets down to an amount the public can remember is just silly. That being said in our Solar system the planets should be: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Luna, Mars, Ceres, Jupiter, Io, Europa, Ganymede, Callisto, Saturn, Mimas, Enceladus, Tethys, Dione, Rhea, Titan, Iapetus, Uranus, Miranda, Ariel, Umbriel, Titania, Oberon, Neptune, Triton, Pluto, Charon, +other named kuiper belt objects Sedna, Quaoar, Ixion, Varuna, Varda, Eris, Haumea, Makemake, etc. Based on that logic there are far more planets in the solar system than 9. Let's just revisit Mercury, Titan, Gaymede, and Callisto. The only reason Mercury which is in the same size class as the other 3 is considered a planet is its orbit which is directly around the sun. Meanwhile Ganymede, Callisto, and Titan are just demoted to the same status as small lumps of rock/ice like the lesser "moons" of Jupiter and Saturn i.e; Adrastea, Amalthea, Epimetheus

The argument for Planet X (now 9) has been going on for decades.  Every generation supplies a new theory based on new evidence.  And it's never been there.  Critics come up with perfectly reasonable explanations for the data that don't involve a new planet.  Proponents dismiss it, say the discovery is just around the corner.  That corner never comes, the buzz dies down, everyone forgets about a new monster planet until someone else finds new data, develops new theories pointing to Planet 9.  Lather, rinse, repeat; lather, rinse, repeat...  Cycle has been going on since Neptune was discovered (Pluto was discovered looking for a Planet 9 that was perturbating Neptune's orbit.  Of course, it had nothing to do with another planet...).  Wake me when someone actually finds something.

While I would love to see a planet named for Bowie, I think if this planet is finally located it should be named "Batygin" - that man has poured his young career and reputation into this, and he deserves the most sincere honor for that commitment. Like some of you, I don't think Planet Batygin would be planet 9, but planet 11 - Pluto must be reconsidered as a planet (given recent New Horizons data), and as Sedna is believed to be larger than Pluto, it must be given the same consideration (pending further data.) I find it interesting that Professor Jewitt was discussing biases and how they would lead those who believe there is a "planet 9" to see evidence for it where there is none; however, I also think that the reverse is true - that newer data is sometimes ignored because it conflicts with what scientists believed in past decades based on the data gathered at that time, which would now have to be acknowledged as being incomplete. A scientist should, on some level, have access to an unlimited imagination - the price paid for a lack of imagination is sacrificing discovery and new knowledge.

I find it interesting how this man proposed that reason we originally classified Pluto as a planet was "Propaganda". While it's true that we did WANT to 9th planet, that was far from the biggest reason. In fact, it's because of his discovery of the Kuiper belt that we don't consider PLuto a planet anymore. It wasn't just because of some massive scandal, it was because our definition of a planet, and our understanding of Pluto itself, has shifted over the years as our understanding of the universe has increased.
I mean, it's not hard to imagine we'd consider Pluto a planet still if there was no Kuiper belt - It's in a binary system with another object, but Pluto is the dominant gravitational force of the two, it's large enough fo pull into a spherical shape under its own gravity... The thing that really turned our thought process was simply that Pluto isn't massive enough to clear out its orbital region.

As at total layman, and just a dude who loves science and learning what he can about cosmology, astrophysics, and particle and quantum physics... I find the young professor quite convincing. Although I completely understand that in science you really can say anything with any sort of conviction without proper the evidence... and not circumstantial evidence at all, but direct observation which is in turn peer-reviewed and studied to death... especially when it’s something as huge of a deal as a 9th planet.

That being said, I also find the old professor guy to seem to be a little too unwilling to even entertain the notion. Maybe he has actually studied the other guys’ work in detail and have come to a very sound conclusion in that regard, but going just from this video, he seems to be a bit biased and a bit set in the status quo and the established paradigm... but in science, one must ALWAYS keep in mind that what is considered to be the well-established and accepted order of understanding a given field or topic is almost always temporary at best. Our understanding of the universe both at the micro AND macro levels is in constant states of revision, and our understanding of our solar solar system is just another example of that.

He should have a more open mind. That is not to say he should just take the young guy’s word for it... but he seems unwilling to even entertain the possibility at all.

There is a 9th and 10th planets. They are Pluto and Charon. They are binary planets, orbiting around each other at a centralized point and share an orbit. If a star system can do that, planets can also (would you call a smaller star orbiting another larger star a planet?)... If you do not consider Pluto to be a planet but a dwarf planet, let me ask this: Is a dwarf human not a human? If you want to use the definition that a planet is a celestial body that has cleaned it's orbit of debris, and smaller objects, then Neptune cannot be considered a planet because Pluto/Charon's orbit enters inside Neptune's at a point (and yes, I know they do not bisect each other). Thus it has not cleaned it's orbital plane. The only definition that strips it of planetary status is the "must be larger than Mercury", which then puts Ganymede and Titan on par with a planet "size wise at least".

But, let's hold on a minute. In 1930 we were told by people who know this stuff, that there are nine planets.
Then, in the late 1990's, we were told that since Pluto didn't fit the bill for being a planet because of its size (sorry, Halley; guess I was wrong) and because of its "wildly tilted elliptical orbit. It was then demoted to "a dwarf." (Aren't we all?)
So we have been looking feverishly for a ninth planet, mainly because we would have to change all those textbooks and revoke all the "First Place" Science Fair models of the solar system that included Pluto. (Imagine how that would effect the PTSD profile!)
But wait yet again (I will say this quietly so as not to upset anyone,) what about Eris?
According to people who know this stuff, "Eris is the most massive known dwarf planet, and the one that helped turn our definition of a planet upside-down. It’s 27% more massive than Pluto and the ninth most massive body that orbits the Sun. It even has a moon: Dysnomia."
So here we are; right back where we started. "Only the names have been changed to protect the innocent."
(Good thing Kennedy didn't say we would put a man [sic] on Pluto by the end of the '60's. They would still be out there looking for it.)

The problem with every theory of a “planet 9” is that *all* of the arguments are actually “you need a center of mass with at least this much mass”. Which means you can explode your “planet” into a large cloud and the math works out just as well. And, well, we see a giant cloud of material. We dont see a planet. So, you then have to say, either the cloud is so big that it accounts for everything, or the mass of the cloud plus an unknown planet is doing it. But the more we look, the bigger the cloud gets, and the smaller the planet gets. Basically, the “planet” is nothing more than the measurement error bar for the size of the cloud. And when you put it that way, the planet is much more likely to not exist than it is to exist.
